posts.post_content: I don't know why anyone rates this below a 4 or better. These are FREE mana ramping and if not used for a free ramp, they can also make very awesome plays with proliferate. Given that the there are only 5-7 turns in the typical game, getting an extra mana for 2 turns is crucial.

posts.post_content:
IMO the double mana depletion lands are highly underrated. There's a reason why they see tournament play; they're a must for any fast deck or a deck that saves up and goes boom all at once. They also make it easier to run fewer lands while still affording your spells.  
  
One of my better decks is a 16 land [glimpse of nature](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=glimpse of nature) deck with these. With less land I can continue the chain-drawing glimpse longer when I finally go boom and yet I can still afford the few expensive spells.
posts.html:
IMO the double mana depletion lands are highly underrated. There's a reason why they see tournament play; they're a must for any fast deck or a deck that saves up and goes boom all at once. They also make it easier to run fewer lands while still affording your spells.

One of my better decks is a 16 land glimpse of nature deck with these. With less land I can continue the chain-drawing glimpse longer when I finally go boom and yet I can still afford the few expensive spells.

posts.post_content:
Question: Can I tap this the second time (plus a forest) to cast [Harrow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Harrow), and sacrifice this land for Harrow's cost before its own sacrifice triggers? It seems I should be able to:  
  
1. Tap, remove last counter. Since mana sources are immediate, I should have two green mana before anything else can happen.  
2. State-based ability goes on the stack. Since this ability is not itself a mana source, I can respond to it with instants.  
3. I cast Harrow, sacrificing the Hickory Woodlot which is still in play until its own ability resolves.  
  
Am I doing this right?  
  
Edit: Yea, that's what it seems like. Oh well, there goes my mediocre combo idea. At least I can still use it once early game and then cast a Harrow later on.
posts.html:
Question: Can I tap this the second time (plus a forest) to cast Harrow, and sacrifice this land for Harrow's cost before its own sacrifice triggers? It seems I should be able to:

1. Tap, remove last counter. Since mana sources are immediate, I should have two green mana before anything else can happen.
2. State-based ability goes on the stack. Since this ability is not itself a mana source, I can respond to it with instants.
3. I cast Harrow, sacrificing the Hickory Woodlot which is still in play until its own ability resolves.

Am I doing this right?

Edit: Yea, that's what it seems like. Oh well, there goes my mediocre combo idea. At least I can still use it once early game and then cast a Harrow later on.

posts.post_content: This, Portal 2 [Bee Sting](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bee Sting), [Coils of the Medusa](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Coils of the Medusa), [Dragon Mask](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragon Mask), [Flailing Ogre](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flailing Ogre), [Flint Golem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flint Golem), [Look at Me, I'm the DCI](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Look at Me, I'm the DCI), [Meng Huo's Horde](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Meng Huo's Horde), [Nalathni Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nalathni Dragon), [Ruby Leech](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ruby Leech), [Stasis](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stasis) and [Verduran Emissary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Verduran Emissary) are cards that were the only card by its illustrator, that I know. posts.post_content: This is a good land. [Vivid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vivid)s aren't that useful when the run out of counters anyway, and graveyard recursion is so easy a ten-year-old could break this. It's not a great land, but I'd run it in any LFTL deck.
posts.html:
